thread.title: North East news LIVE: Wallsend house fire; plus latest breaking news, sport and travel updates

author: Daniel Milligan
title: North East news LIVE: Wallsend house fire; plus latest breaking news, sport and travel updates
text:
We’ve got a broken down car on the Coast Road. 
It’s at the slip road coming off towards Benfield Road. 08:20 Daniel Milligan Ryhope Road busy 
Traffic moving well on the A1018 Ryhope Road heading into Sunderland. 
The worst of the congestion is between the B1522 Ocean Road and B1405 Queen Alexandra Road / Leechmere Road towards the roundabout. 08:15 Daniel Milligan 
The Great North Road is looking busy this morning for anyone heading towards Gosforth. 08:08 Daniel Milligan Coast Road collision 
There has been a collision on the Coast Road heading to the Corner House from Chillingham Road. 08:04 Daniel Milligan Heavy traffic 
Heavy traffic on A167 in both directions between A691 Southfield Way and A690 Neville’s Cross Bank. 
Heavy traffic on A690 in both directions between A691 Framwelgate / Millburngate (The Gates Roundabout) and A181 Gilesgate / St Hild’s Lane / Gilesgate ( Gilesgate Roundabout). In the roadworks area. 08:00 Daniel Milligan 
Here is the front page of today’s Chronicle. 07:53 Daniel Milligan 
If you’re heading south on the A1, this may affect you. 07:48 Daniel Milligan 
Looks like a day not to miss your hayfever tablets. 07:42 Daniel Milligan All you need to know about Blaydon Race 
Blaydon Race runners will be “gannin’ alang the Scotswood Road” again on the 9th of June as the Newcastle tradition returns. 
The annual 5.7 mile race is steeped in local tradition with more than 4,000 runners from all over the world taking part. 
It has been organised annually by Blaydon H & AC since 1981 and is aimed at top athletes and fun runners alike. 
Unfortunately, places for this year’s race are full but if you want to go along to show your support for friends or family here is everything you need to know about this year’s race. 
The 1862 Blaydon Races song is widely regarded as the national anthem of Tyneside and is the inspiration behind the event. But it only became an actual road race in 1981 and was the brainchild of Dr James Dewar, of Blaydon Harriers, who organised the first 24 races. Video loading Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video 07:37 Daniel Milligan Dangers of the sea campaign 
The mother of a teenage girl who died after being swept into the North Sea in January is appealing for parents to make sure their kids know to take extra care when walking or playing around the sea. 
Caitlin Ruddy was 15, was dragged out by a huge wave as she walked along Cullercoats Pier on January 16. She died later in hospital despite a rescue attempt by Cullercoats’ RNLI crew. 
Her mum, Sabrina Cook, is backing the RNLI’s Respect the Water campaign, as the lifeboat charity revealed 22 people lost their lives by the coast in the North East last year. 
Almost half of the 122 those killed in coastal fatalities between 2011 and 2014 were not planning on getting in the water. Many, like Caitlin, were simply walking or running near the sea and were dragged in by freak waves. 07:30 Daniel Milligan Wallsend house fire 
The bedroom of a house in Wallsend was gutted as a fire ripped through the property. 
Firefighters from Gosforth were called to the two-storey house in Merlin Crescent in Wallsend at 1.13am. 
A spokesman for Tyne and Wear Fire and Rescue Service said the people living in the house managed to get out of the property before they arrived. 
They said the first-floor bedroom was destroyed by fire and the rest of the first floor was damaged by smoke. 
Firefighters used two hose reels and positive pressure ventilation equipment to clear the smoke from the house. 
No-one was hurt. 07:25 Daniel Milligan Rush-hour round-up 
Slow traffic on A194(M) Northbound between A182 Washington Highway / B1288 (Havannah Interchange) and A194 Leam Lane / A184 / A184 Newcastle Road (White Mare Pool Roundabout). 
Slow traffic on A167(M) Southbound between A167 and A186 City Road / A186 Mosley Street / Pilgrim Street (Swanhouse Roundabout). 
Slow traffic on A695 Eastbound between Stargate Lane (Stargate Roundabout) and A69. 07:21 Daniel Milligan On the roads 
Very slow traffic on A19 Northbound between A184 Newcastle Road ( Testo’s Roundabout) and A185 (Tyne Tunnel). 
Also, very slow traffic on A184 Newcastle Road Westbound between A194 Leam Lane / A194(M) / A184 White Mare Pool Roundabout and A185 Shields Road / B1426 Shields Road ( Heworth Roundabout). 07:16 Daniel Milligan Hundreds putting their sight at risk 
Eye specialists in Newcastle fear hundreds of people in the North East are at risk of going blind because of a lack of awareness about glaucoma. 
The condition can be present for many years without a person being aware of it, as there are no symptoms in the early stages. 
If left untreated, glaucoma can lead to serious loss of vision, with up to 40% of sight being permanently lost before the effects are noticed. 
While the damage caused by glaucoma is permanent, early diagnosis and treatment can prevent vision-threatening loss. The key to treating glaucoma successfully is diagnosing it early. 07:10 Daniel Milligan Gordon Brown at the Sage Gateshead 
Former Prime Minister leader Gordon Brown took centre stage again this time in a European Union referendum event at a packed Sage Gateshead tonight. 
He told an audience of Labour supporters how the EU had helped the North East recover from the “devastation” he said was inflicted by Tory Governments in the 1970s and 80s, and that the union would continue to “defend” the region into the future. 
Opening on a whimsical note with an anecdote about Albert Einstein, who he said had once travelled around Britain speaking about Europe giving the same speech everywhere he went, Mr Brown said he would be taking a different tactic, focusing on the issues the question of Brexit raised in the North East specifically. 07:05 Daniel Milligan Blaydon Race day 
With the Blaydon Race just a day away, what better way to celebrate than to listen to the ‘anthem of Tyneside’ - The Blaydon Races. 
Written in 1862 by Geordie Ridley the original Blaydon Races song tells the story of a mad-cap journey to this highlight of the Tyneside calendar on June 9. 
Over the centuries the Blaydon Races became a Geordie anthem with a well-deserved place in the life of the region, but do you know all the words? 
Ahead of this year’s event, we asked local musician Simma, aka as Anthony Simpson, to perform the Blaydon Races at The Vermont Hotel’s Sky Lounge with the back drop of the Tyne Bridge and Sage Gateshead. 
We’ve even added the words - in traditional Geordie style of course - on the screen to help you sing along. 
Simma, from Benwell, has been building a loyal following across the North East since 1997 as a solo acoustic artist and singer-songwriter. 
The accomplished musician is well-known across the region for his music and for running Acoustic Circus, which hosts regular busker and open mic nights. Video loading Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video 07:00 Daniel Milligan International news 
Police opened fire on a man armed with a knife in a Sydney shopping centre, wounding him and three female bystanders. 
Officers were called to the mall in the northern suburb of Hornsby following reports that a man was armed with a knife, New South Wales. 
Officers approached the man and a confrontation broke out. The man then approached the officers with a large carving knife, and two officers opened fire. He was wounded several times, and three women were also hurt. 
The women, who are between 60 and 80-years-old, and the man were being treated at various hospitals and were all in stable condition. 06:55 Daniel Milligan 
One to watch out for on the Metros this morning. 06:49 Daniel Milligan Other fire service callouts 
Crews were called out to a number of incidents overnight, including: Fire crews from West Denton responded to report of a fire in a commercial building in Cowgate area of Newcastle. This was a false alarm. A team from Sunderland attended a house fire in the Hendon area of Sunderland. People were advised to leave the property safely. Crews from Byker and Newcastle Central have extinguished a car on fire in Newcastle Fire crews from Swalwell and Byker dealt with a crash involving two vehicles in the Teams area of Gateshead. 06:42 Daniel Milligan Wallsend house fire destroys bedroom 
The bedroom of a house in Wallsend was gutted as a fire ripped through the property. 
Firefighters from Gosforth were called to the two-storey house in Merlin Crescent in Wallsend at 1.13am. 
A spokesman for Tyne and Wear Fire and Rescue Service said the people living in the house managed to get out of the property before they arrived. 
They said the first-floor bedroom was destroyed by fire and the rest of the first floor was damaged by smoke. 
Firefighters used two hose reels and positive pressure ventilation equipment to clear the smoke from the house. 
No-one was hurt. 06:35 Daniel Milligan Thursday's weather forecast 
Early cloud and any mist will gradually clear back to the coast leaving another warm day with sunshine. Dry for most but isolated heavy showers will develop during the afternoon, especially over the Pennines. Staying cooler near the coast. Maximum Temperature 21 °C. 
Tonight: Clear spells to start the night but becoming rather cloudy with some showery rain possible in places. Patchy mist and hill fog may form overnight too. Minimum Temperature 8 °C. 06:30 Daniel Milligan Good morning 
Welcome to The Chronicle’s live breaking news blog for Thursday, 9, 2016. 
Here, are our regular updates throughout the day of all the breaking news and sport from across the North East. 
We have pictures, video, tweets and comments covering the latest Newcastle and North East traffic, weather forecasts, crime and council news too. 
I’m Daniel Milligan and I’ll be keeping you updated on what’s going on across the region including the latest on the roads for the rush-hour and any breaking news incidents that occur as we move through the day. 
You can contribute to the live blog by posting your comment below, and you can also tweet us @EveningChron to share breaking news stories, pictures and opinions. 
Phone: 0191 201 6169
